comments:
If Resource.getEObject is given a bogus URI it throws an NPE
The Javadoc indicates it should throw a WrappedException

java.lang.NullPointerException
	at java.lang.Throwable.<init>(Throwable.java)
	at java.lang.Throwable.<init>(Throwable.java)
	at java.lang.NullPointerException.<init>(NullPointerException.java:61)
	at 
org.eclipse.emf.ecore.impl.BasicEObjectImpl.eDerivedStructuralFeatureID
(BasicEObjectImpl.java:768)
	at com.ibm.wbit.ae.sacl.impl.StateMachineDefinitionImpl.eGet
(StateMachineDefinitionImpl.java:545)
	at 
org.eclipse.emf.ecore.impl.BasicEObjectImpl.eObjectForURIFragmentSegment
(BasicEObjectImpl.java:273)
	at 
com.ibm.wbit.ae.sacl.impl.StateMachineDefinitionImpl.eObjectForURIFragmentSegme
nt(StateMachineDefinitionImpl.java:845)
	at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.resource.impl.ResourceImpl.getEObject
(ResourceImpl.java:621)
	at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.resource.impl.ResourceImpl.getEObject
(ResourceImpl.java:595)

We'll do this instead:

throw new IllegalArgumentException("The feature '" + name + "' is not a valid
feature");

This fix is committed to CVS.
